column7: Does the city have event management plans formulated to address the "most probable" and "most severe" disaster scenarios of the following hazards?

Are the event management plans shared and signed off by all relevant actors?

Has the event management plans been tested as practice drills?
Has the event management plans been tested in real emergencies?
Does the city have an emergency response plan for disasters in general?
Are they covering command and control - coordination with other agencies and cities; roles; responsibilities?
Are they covering evacuations (including hospitals; jails; etc.)?
Are they covering communication systems?
Are they covering critical asset management (including system of systems interactions)?
Are they covering first response?
Are they covering law and order response?
Are they covering public information?
Are they covering incorporation of contributions from citizen/grass roots organization?
Does the city have emergency operation centres for the following hazards?
Are all relevant actors coordinated to operate the emergency operation centres?
Does the city have evacuation centres?
Does the evacuation centres expect the following hazards?
Does the city have a post event recovery plan for All Hazards?
Does it address economic needs?
Does it address infrastructure needs?
Does it address community needs?
Does it detailed interim arrangements for damaged facilities and homes anticipated from "most probable" and "most severe" scenarios (e.g shelter)?
Does it detailed triage policies for repairs?
Does it detailed counseling and personal support arrangements?
Does it detailed community support arrangements?
Does it detailed economic “re-boot” arrangements – interim tax relief or incentives; etc?
Does it detailed Improvements to city layout and operations sought as rebuilding takes place; that will reduce future risk?
Are post event organization arrangements prepared for the following hazards?
Are post event organization arrangements prepared for the following hazards?
Does the city have a post event financial arrangements to deal with fiancial aid from external sources and disbursements concerning the following hazards?

Does the local government estimate the shortfall in staff/responders per defined needs* – potentially from multiple sources for the following hazards?!*fire; ambulance; healthcare; neighborhood support etc.
Has the local government signed Memorandums of understanding (MOUs) on cooperation in case of shortfall in staff/responders with private/civic sectors for the following hazards?
Are the staff/responders needs for the "most probable" and the "most severe" disaster scenarios estimated for the following hazards?

Does the city have sufficient back-up or para-professional capacity* to maintain law and order under any of the disaster scenarios?!*This capacity may come from other agencies such as the Army or civil defense force
Can the back-up or para-professional capacity support first responders duties?
Does the local government estimate the shortfall in equipment* per defined needs – potentially from multiple sources for the following hazards?!*fire trucks; ambulances; cranes; medical supplies etc.
Has the local government signed Memorandums of understanding (MOUs) on cooperation in case of shortfall in available equipment with private/civic sectors for the following hazards?
Are the equipment* needs for the "most probable" and the "most severe" disaster scenarios estimated for the following hazards?!*fire trucks; ambulances; cranes; medical supplies etc.
Does the local government estimate the shortfall in supplies per defined needs – potentially from multiple sources for the following hazards?
Has the local government signed MOUs on cooperation in case of shortfall in available supplies with private/civic sectors for the following hazards?
Are the supply needs for the "most probable" and the "most severe" disaster scenarios estimated for the following hazards?
Is there estimation of the level of compatibility from different key systems (e.g. diameter of fire hoses; type of consent; electricity transmission standards etc.) within the public sector?
Is there estimation of the level of compatibility from different key systems (e.g. diameter of fire hoses; type of consent; electricity transmission standards etc.) within the private sector?
